column4: Hi.  I just installed ubuntu (on a dif computer) and i have troubles
I have a wireless adapter, and i cannot connect to my wireless network
can someone help me?
Can someone plz help me?
I have a wireless adapter and network,
and ubuntu won't connect to the wireless network.
When windows xp was my OS, it could connect easily and yes it does
it just fails to connect
but it is detected, and detects access points?
you just need to forget bad habits, and start from scratch.
but keep in mind, you can have the best of both worlds.
since you legally own a license to use windows you could always download an xp iso or something.
linux was made to do anything. ubuntu uses a desktop called gnome, which is mildly inspired/based on mac operating systems.
applications > accessories > terminal
http://google.com
it's because you're a good little clone ;)
PS: hit ctrl + T
sudo tasksel
choose kubuntu desktop, okay.
so accept it.... have you ever used computers before? i don't mean to take offence, but i'm just wondering.
yes i understand, but did you have much experience using windows?
maybe because you're already running synaptic or another package management program
you can only run one.
